H0.text: Greenhouse gases are gases that absorb heat in the atmosphere.

H1.text: Microwave gases are gases that absorb heat in the atmosphere.

H2.text: Ozone gases are gases that absorb heat in the atmosphere.

H3.text: Carbonate gases are gases that absorb heat in the atmosphere.

A4.text: Greenhouse gases are infrared active, meaning that they absorb and emit infrared radiation in the same long wavelength range as what is emitted by the Earth's surface, clouds and atmosphere.

A5.text: tropospheric ozone, because this gas has a cooling effect in the stratosphere, but a warming influence comparable to nitrous oxide and CFCs in the troposphere.

A6.text: Greenhouse gases absorb 90% of the longwave radiation emitted by the surface, thus accumulating energy and warming the Earth's surface.

A7.text: Greenhouse gases contribute most of the greenhouse effect in Earth's energy budget.
